displayed_text: Patient: Uh huh. Doctor: So in other words invisible and resistant to hormone therapy, and then we basically do the screening procedures and if you pass the screening then we enroll you in the trial. Patient: Okay. Doctor: But again, I didn’t want to go into a huge amount of detail because it’s a little bit premature. Patient: Uh huh. Doctor: And it would require also that you go back on the Lupron, which I’m not sure that you would want to do that. So just Patient: Yeah, but if needs be, we can do it, we can do it. There’s another drug that we were on, too, besides Lupron. Doctor: It’s called Zytiga, also known as Abiraterone. Patient: It’s Zytiga. Right. Zytiga. Doctor: And one of the things that you and I have discussed before, and that this might be true especially if you don’t participate in the trial, would be you know could we start the Zytiga without the Lupron. Patient: Yes. Doctor: Okay, in other words, could we have your oral therapy with the absence of or without the Lupron?

Family Member: So they don’t die… Doctor: Correct. Patient: I see oh yeah, yeah, yeah we’re still on that. Doctor: This is a shot that’s - why that shot is important is just because it’s just a one time and then it’s good. Patient: Yeah. Doctor: But the alternative cheaper version of that is a daily shot to keep your cells up. Patient: Yeah. Doctor: I know, I’m sorry. Patient: And you would recommend that at least at a minimum? Doctor: Well, you know there’s two ways to approach this. We could wait until you really are in trouble. And in trouble would mean you have a fever, you have no white cells, you better come in to the hospital, you need antibiotics. Patient: Yeah I don’t know (stammering) Doctor: But you’ve already demonstrated that your cells go down. You know you weren’t doing great. I just think we’re asking for trouble. So I’ve tried to explain that and they’re like is it a fever with no white cells. That’s all the understand. Patient: Yeah.

Patient: I’ll go with that line of action first. Doctor: And then you’re going to say, boy, that doctor, she’s really smart. (Laughter) Doctor: Yeah. Yeah. Be sure you don’t like, you know, sleep so hard that you forget to pee if you actually have to pee. Doctor: I’m just saying seven p.m. Okay. Bye. Patient: Okay. So I got – she took – oh, I do, right here. Doctor: You do have sheet to go. Patient: Oh, okay. Doctor: Alright. See you guys soon.
